name: Mixed Bag 18 Quiz | Mixed 10 Q. Tough [C] | 10 Questions

questions.text: Where is the jaguar most commonly found?
questions.explanation:
Americas.

	Found from the southern United States to northern Argentina but mostly abundant in the dense forests of Central America and Brazil.

questions.text: If your plane had landed at Haneda International Airport what country would you be in ?
questions.explanation:
Japan.

	Haneda was replaced by Narita Airport in 1978.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a palace in Rome?
questions.explanation:
Rose Court.

	Farnese Palace occupies an entire city block, while Barberini Palace is noted for its picture gallery.

questions.text: The garter snake may bear as many as how many young?
questions.explanation:
85.

	There are about 15 species of the garter snake found in the United States, all of them harmless. Their usual litter is 6 to 25.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a site for a famous musical festival?
questions.explanation:
Atlantic City.

	The Aspen Musical Festival was founded by Walter Paepcke. The music festival located at Spoleto is located in Italy and Newport, Rhode Island is noted for its jazz festival.

questions.text: Which is not a musical instrument?
questions.explanation:
Mandarin.

	A mandarin is an official of the Chinese Empire either civil or military.

questions.text: Which is younger a larva or a pupa?
Where would you find Monte Carlo?
questions.explanation:
Monaco.

	It is located on the French Riviera and is famous for its gambling casino.

questions.text: How many days are there in a fortnight?
questions.explanation:
14.

	A fortnight is a period of two weeks.

questions.text: What is the official language of Greenland?
questions.explanation:
Greenlandic.

	Greenland's capital and largest city is Nuuk (formerly Godthab), a town founded in 1721.
